en.title: From 'Asking AI' to 'Having AIs Discuss' Era
en.excerpt: The era of asking AI for a single answer is over. By assigning roles to multiple AIs and having them discuss, deep insights and creative solutions emerge that one person could never reach alone.
en.description: Learn practical methods and effects of the new AI utilization method of having multiple AIs discuss. Discover how to create your own 'AI team' with success stories from GIZIN AI Team.
en.content:
# From 'Asking AI' to 'Having AIs Discuss' Era

## You Don't Need to Worry Alone Anymore

"I wonder if there's a better idea for this project..."
"Technically it's possible, but what about legally..."
"I can't predict customer reactions..."

What do you do in such situations? Ask AI a question, get one answer, and that's it?

If so, you're using less than 10% of AI's true power.

## Have You Ever Had AIs "Discuss"?

Imagine sales experts, technical specialists, and legal professionals seriously discussing your project.

"From a sales perspective, this feature will resonate with customers"
"But technically, it'll take 3 months to implement"
"From a legal standpoint, we should avoid this expression..."

This is the world of assigning roles to multiple AIs and having them discuss.

## The Decisive Difference Between Single AI and Multiple AI Discussion

### Traditional: Asking AI (Flat)

When you ask "Give me new product ideas":

"How about this product? Its features are..."

Sure, you get an answer. But it's a flat response from a single perspective.

### New Era: Having AIs Discuss (Three-dimensional)

When three AIs discuss from sales, technical, and design perspectives:

> Sales AI: "Customer research shows simplicity is desired"
> Tech AI: "But simplifying removes differentiation..."
> Design AI: "We can hide complexity with UI and achieve both"

Suddenly, depth emerges in the discussion, and unexpected solutions surface.

## Why "Depth" Emerges

### 1. Realizing Cognitive Diversity

Like human teams, when members with different perspectives gather, they illuminate problems from angles invisible to one person. By assigning roles, AIs also demonstrate role-specific thinking patterns.

### 2. Effect of Constructive Conflict

Opinion conflicts like "I disagree" promote deeper consideration. In AI discussions too, objections from different positions catalyze deeper thinking.

### 3. Emergence of Collective Intelligence

1+1 becomes 3 or 4. That's the power of collective intelligence. Through interaction, multiple AIs generate insights beyond individual AI capabilities.

## Let's Try It (Easy 3 Steps)

Think it's difficult? Don't worry, it's surprisingly simple.

### Step 1: Open Multiple AI Windows

Open Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini, or any AI you like in three browser tabs. You can even open the same AI three times.

### Step 2: Assign Roles to Each

For example:
- First: "You are the sales manager"
- Second: "You are the technical lead"
- Third: "You are the customer support manager"

### Step 3: Throw in a Discussion Topic

"Please discuss pricing for our new service"

Then share each AI's opinion with the others, like a meeting facilitator.

## Example: The Perfect PDF Born from 31 Improvements

At GIZIN AI Team, one late night, three AIs collaborated to create an educational PDF.

> Planning AI: "The structure is good, but needs more visuals"
> Dev AI: "Technically implemented. But it's too heavy..."
> Design AI: "Optimizing this part will make it lighter"

After 31 improvements, a PDF was completed that made everyone think "I want to buy this!" With one AI, it would have stopped at "good enough" after about 5 iterations.

## Applications Are Limitless

### For Business Decisions

Having AIs discuss from finance, sales, and HR perspectives enables balanced business decisions.

### For Creative Work

AIs responsible for plot, characters, and world-building can collaborate to create stories with depth.

### For Education

AIs playing teacher, student, and parent roles discussing can find multifaceted educational approaches.

## Your Role Changes

Using this method, your role changes from "questioner" to "facilitator."

Guiding AI discussions, organizing arguments, throwing in new perspectivesâ€”like an orchestra conductor, you draw out the maximum potential of AIs.

## An Era Where Anyone Can Have an "AI Team"

Once, only large companies could have excellent teams. But not anymore.

Starting today, you too can "hire" a sales manager, technical lead, legal counsel, marketing expertâ€”everyone. And they work 24/7 without complaints.

## Ready to Start?

The era of "asking AI" is over. Now is the era of "having AIs discuss."

No difficult technology needed. All you need is imagination to combine multiple perspectives and curiosity to guide discussions.

Open three tabs in your browser right now and create your own AI team. You'll surely find answers you couldn't see before.

ðŸ’¡ **Hint**: It's OK to start with two AIs. Just having "supporters" and "opponents" discuss can lead to new discoveries.
